website_summaries.verdict: Exploring a plastic version of Middle-earth is immensely satisfying in Lego The Lord of the Rings.
pros: Tells the familiar story in a satisfying wayLots of goodies to uncoverExploration is encouraged and funFaithful to the spirit of the source material
cons: Stages can get repetitive when played aloneOccasional bugs can sometimes annoy

customer_reviews.title: Good game, beautiful graphics but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Love the gameplay, although I wish the world was a bit more open like the LEGO Hobbit game. Another nitpick is there isn't much ability to explore and they very much rush the cutscenes. I get these are long movies to adapt into a game mostly aimed at a younger audience but c'mon, you spend through Hobbiton like the Flash.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Vanslooten

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Fun.
customer_reviews.text: Such an awesome game. Follows the storyline EXACTLY and uses the actual voices and music from the Lord of the Rings movies. Very easy to play, and super fun. You get to be all kinds of characters too: All 9 members of the Fellowship, Galadriel, Gollum, the Witch King, Faramir, Treebeard, Elrond, Sauron himself (in a secret level...), King of the dead army, and many more! 1-2 player game. Includes all 3 LOTR movies. Fun for all ages. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkiesAhead

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable, typical LEGO game
customer_reviews.text: Product came sealed and new. Some glitches here and there but on the whole, all you'd expect from the LEGO movie-gaming franchise, including original voices from the films.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Filn

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game...
customer_reviews.text: This Lego game is probably the best one to date. Even Batman 2 didn't impress me much... not sure why. But Lego LOTR is just really fun to play for the whole family. I really enjoy how you can explore Middle-Earth pretty freely and I enjoy the quests. That's all I have left to do in the game, really. But there seems to be a few bugs here and there, but nothing to that really makes the game bad in any way. I'm really hoping Lego makes a Spongebob game, lol. They made the Spongebob Legos... why not a game? I'll bet that would be really fun... exploring Bikini Bottom, lol. My son would flip over a Lego Spongebob game.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Revived the LEGO franchise for US!!
customer_reviews.text: My boys (ages 9 and 11) loved this game much more than I ever expected when I purchased it. We had always been big fans of the LEGO Wii games, but they had moved on to the XBox360 platform and left the LEGO games behind.....UNTIL....LEGO LOTR!! They played it non-stop the first weekend and had to be pried away from the TV (they usually are pretty minimal video game players)!! Love that the voicings are actually the ones from the movie as that really adds to enjoyment of these for both the parents and the kids! Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: Great title for ages 3 and up
customer_reviews.text: My son is 3 and a huge fan of the lego franchise, And I a big fan of Tolkien's LOTR and Hobbit series, All that being said this game is a great way for father and son to bond and spend time together doing something we can both enjoy . lord of the rings is a little more complicated for younger ages unlike the batman lego series . I would recommend batman lego 2 before moving on to lord of the rings if you are playing with a younger child . It is a great game for all ages .
customer_reviews.author: Vivadsanchez

customer_reviews.title: Playing the movie
customer_reviews.text: I was curious how Lego would make this monster of a movie series into a lovable Lego game. They take actual dialog from the movies and add it to the game here with a few additional voices for side quests. Yep, you read correctly, there are side quests. When I first discovered this I was ecstatic. It plays like a Lego RPG. The music is plucked directly from the movies as well which make this extremely epic. This game has the action you'd expect from Lego plus a few stealth missions as well. The added bonus.... you get to race a sheep. Kid. You. Not.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Harris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a fan of the movie Lord of the Rings this game is sweet as it follows the movie very closely. It has tons of secrets to unlock and has replay with getting those secrets and the coop. The splitscreen is customizable but I got used to the diagonal split screen and ended up liking it the best. Took me awhile to beat the game and will play through it again. So overall the controls were easy, game length was good and very enjoyable. Even kid friendly my 3 year old loved pushing the buttons playing somewhat decent and loved watching the awesome lego scenes.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Another fun LEGO Adventure
customer_reviews.text: This game is probably one of the most comprehensive LOTR games out there. By this I mean players get to experience all their favorite scenes from the movies, and the fact that you get to are able to view the Middle Earth map and follow the same path that Frodo and other characters did. I enjoyed visiting the Shire, Rivendell, and Gondor. It was fun, but gathering all the extra items to reach 100% took a long time. Occasionally, it was hard to determine where to go next which is why I gave it 4 stars. I own all of the other LEGO games, and I personally enjoy the Harry Potter ones the most.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Wtf
customer_reviews.text: I was really not excited for this game becaus...ya know...LEGO. But my friend downloaded the demo and we tried it and two weeks later I bought the game. This game is great, it's funny and a lot of the humor comes from the serious dialogue and scenes and the character's actions in the backgrounds. There's stuff for fans of the movies and the books too. It's enjoyable to play, suprisingly beautiful and detailed in certain parts, and great for casual playing or 100% completionists. Plus you can play as Lord Sauron. A+ would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aximili

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the LEGO game line going strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the LEGO games. To be fair, I prefer action/adventure games, puzzle, games and RPGs as opposed to first person games. So if you're getting this game as a gift, consider what type of gamer you're buying for. I think it's perfect for young gamers. Any violence is LEGO violence with LEGO pieces flying as opposed to blood and gore; kids pull their LEGOs apart all the time when they're playing. I always like the Easter eggs and fun stuff that the game makers throw in as well. The game is not high on the challenge meter but allows for a solid amount of gaming fun. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO game for any fan of the films.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for myself because I'm a LoTR movie fan. I have seen all three films and really enjoy them, so I figured I would enjoy playing this game. I like the gameplay overall. It feels like you're watching one of the movies whenever a cutscene plays which is really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: This game was lots of fun for my kids, they love LEGO games and it was wonderful to be able to play with them.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Best Lego Game Yet--- Love the Voiceovers from the Film
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are fantastic-- best in all the Lego games, and we have all of them. Very tasteful use of the soundtrack. And best of all, the voiceovers from the actual film really make this experience like being in the film. It's done very well, not a gimmicky thing. It makes following the storyline so much easier than in other Lego games, where the characters merely grunt and wave their hands. The kids are blown away by it and I am happy to play it over and over after the 4-year-old continues to delete the game file.
customer_reviews.author: rhirhi

customer_reviews.title: Grandson birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: My grandson wanted this game for his birthday. He does enjoy playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Lego games are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These games are so much fun. If you don't like the movies, don't worry, the games are fun on their own..but as additions to the movies they are great. The LOTR tie ins are cool because they are the 1st in the Lego series to use the real dialogue from the films. I play with my 15yr old daughter. We have all of them. You can play for fun because you never really die, or you can play to complete the challenges. I would recommend this for everyone! btw, the graphics and video are beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kean

customer_reviews.title: It's LEGO.  It's Lord of the Rings.  It's XBOX.  It's FUN!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a child of the male persuasion, you have probably been exposed to one or more of the LEGO games in this family. Star Wars, Batman, Harry Potter, Clone Wars, Indiana Jones, they all play more or less the same albeit with a few different quirks. They are fun and combine enough puzzle solving along with the button pushing to keep adults interested enough to play along. We like the XBOX version more than the WII - we don't have a playstation to compare against.
customer_reviews.author: ljmiii

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Lego game
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of the Lego games for a few years now; sometimes its nice to kick back with something not to frustrating or addictive as an FRS or RPG. The open world aspect of this one is fantastic, though! Instead of a lobby where you choose what level you play, you're given the ability to wander around Middle Earth, doing a bunch of other stuff (collect coins, buy characters, experience changing environments, even take on side quests), making is more immersive experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ben ZW

customer_reviews.title: LOTR - good but little things a bit off
customer_reviews.text: I really like this game but at times I'm not sure what my next move is. I don't really don't want to go to cheat sites like IGN for help so I puzzle it out with some frustration at times. The graphics and tracking could be better. I seem to compare all such Lego games to Harry Potter years 1-4 which I absolutely love without reservations. The game is fun. I like that they have incorporated voicing from the movie. When I have played more of this game, my opinions might change some.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader Too

customer_reviews.title: The Lego games are all pretty good, my family owns just about all of ...
customer_reviews.text: The Lego games are all pretty good, my family owns just about all of them. Lego LOTR continues the trend of a fun, and witty game that you can put lots of time into. The only reason I give four instead of five stars, and really that goes more to the source material than the game maker, is the lack of puzzles or side missions that say Lego Harry Potter, or Lego Indiana Jones have. Tolkien's universe definitely possess's the depth to have allowed the makers to fashion something to meet out the game beyond simply going from chapter to chapter until finished but there you go.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gremillion

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: This is not reverse compatible. This fact should be noted.
customer_reviews.author: Aquaman

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: My sons love this and it is a nice change from their other Lego games which they have played to death.
customer_reviews.author: HistoryBuff

customer_reviews.title: Great game for the family or yourself
customer_reviews.text: It is an amazing rendition of the movies with a lot of little humor thrown in. Having never played any of the lego series before I was looking for something my wife and I could play on the xbox that basically was just collecting dust. Both of us love the game and have a lot of fun with it. I started playing by myself as I'm OCD enough that I need to find the secrets and as much of the stash as possible. So if you're looking for a great multiplayer game that can appeal to both casual and hardcore collective playstyles then this is a great game for both types of players and is also great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Climber

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Great game for LOTR fans! Incorporates all of the LOTR movies into the game and uses the character dialogue from the movie as well! Lots of fun for all ages, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Coconut Lover

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves the Lego Games
customer_reviews.text: The Lego games are the only games I can get my wife to play. I think they are a little repetitive (as far as the hard core gamers are concerned they are really repetitive) but I like that the developers are aware of that. The repetitive game play makes it easier to incorporate the puns and silliness that the game has when comparing it to the movie. I have got a few chuckles out of the game (as most of the other lego games have done). Bottom line, it is a fun game to play with the family to kill some time.
customer_reviews.author: kv

customer_reviews.title: This game rocks!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so much fun - got it for my husband for his birthday since he loved the LEGO Star Wars. It plays more like an RPG though with lots of hidden missions and we can both play which is nice. My only beef is its hard to find some of the items characters are looking for without reading a walkthrough (i.e. I left it in the swamp somewhere...go fetch!). And there are lots of jumping missions to get the lego blocks. Man jumping is rough. What is with the jumping?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ransom

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy something with your children or by yourself...either way...great game!
customer_reviews.text: Another excellent game by Lego that I can't stop playing! I have spent many nights in my chair playing this awesome game! It's great, clean fun and has a great story-line. Enjoy something with your children or by yourself...either way...great game!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A. Bates

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. My wife and I played it a couple winters ago and got really into it! Beat the whole game and had a lot of fun together doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GAME
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It has all the classic antics that are expected with a good Lego Video game. The game kept me entertained the whole way through and has enough bonus features and add-ons to keep you busy. The story line follows the basic new line cinema plot with just enough humor to make it fresh and fun to play. There are some challenging bonus features to unlock and I wouldn't imagine that a younger child could do them. They involve jumping to excessive heights on narrow platforms and the screen doesn't always catch up orientation wise which was a little frustrating but no nearly enough to sway my adult opinion of this game.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Great condition and actually came new, which is nice. Can’t wait to get to play it with my mom.
customer_reviews.author: doyle hunter

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Can play my favorite game again cause my older one broke
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a relatively simple game that didn't take a long time to learn. This is great the game it is simple but not overly so, and is extremely entertaining to play. The story follows the movies, the characters use dialogue directly from them, but it adds in a twist of humor that I found really fun. It is my first time to play one of the Lego games and I'll probably pick up the rest after the positive experience with this one. Very kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Great fun - but not for young kids
customer_reviews.text: Rated Everyone, but it's really more like 10 years old and up who would be mature enough to read the book or watch the movie. So feels like PG-13. Real voices form the movie are in - a big difference with many other Lego titles. Also some inventory management (simple) is involved, making the game a little more complex to use for kids compared to a lego star wars or lego harry potter.
customer_reviews.author: T.Perraut

customer_reviews.title: Family Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game will provide a bunch of hours of entertainment, this by far is one of the best lego games so far, my sons and I have played them all. This one has so many different adventures and characters. You think you are almost done but then you find all the little side adventures to unlock all the special abilities so you have to go back and see if you can find items characters are asking you to find. We have spent hours playing.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Hershey

customer_reviews.title: One of the best logo games
customer_reviews.text: If you're already a fan of lego games then this game will meet all of your expectations. It has all the charm that a lego game should have. You can tell that they have improved on some of the bugs of past lego games. They are beginning to expand the capabilities of lego games. You can do things like rotate your view and hold an inventory of items. The game is also very true to the heart of the Lord of the Rings series. It's a very fun adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Hours and hours of fun (even if you are in your 40s like me!)
customer_reviews.text: I have already invested about 10 hours into this game, and am only at the 10% complete mark. I love a good puzzler, and this LEGO game delivers. You have to perform certain actions with a certain character, and some have been mind boggling! I even enjoy just running around and whacking the environment to up my rivet collection. Some may think it gets stale reliving all three LOTR movies via the interjected LEGO-ized movies, but I have found they only add to the experience, it's like living the movies instead of just watching. I look forward to revisiting the places I've been with the additional characters I've unlocked and explore further.
customer_reviews.author: Zebstriped

customer_reviews.title: Review for Lego Lord od the rings
customer_reviews.text: This game follows all three of the lord of the rings movies.In my opinion this is one of the best Lego games and the most challenging as well although this game is challenging it is also very fun as well
customer_reviews.author: naomi

customer_reviews.title: My sons loved it and it was great watching him play it
customer_reviews.text: Follows the trilogy exactly!! My sons loved it and it was great watching him play it. Very good game!!
customer_reviews.author: engnir1

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Lego games
customer_reviews.text: This game is great for young and old. I am 27 years old and I own every single Lego game! If you play these games you know that a trademark of the lego games is none of the legos talk. So imagine my surprise when I put the game in and started hearing the actual audio from the movie! Even though it doesn't go with the norm it adds an amazing dimension to this game. It is really the audio from the movies!
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Game!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited for this game to come out. I have played Lego Indiana Jones, Lego Batman, Lego Pirates of the Caribbean and all the Lego Star Wars games. I own them all. This game does not disappoint. I really enjoyed how the dialog from the movie was included in this game. It all felt so epic and is a great companion to the epic movies... hmmm, will there be a hobbit version? I would totally buy that.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S. Dohm

customer_reviews.title: Great game and gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an 8 year old boy who loves Lego video games. He was very excited to receive it and even started playing it as soon as he could get the plastic off! It's a great addition to any Lego video game collection you may have.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Adkins

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I'm 16 and i really shouldn't enjoy this game so much. But, my roommate and I played this non-stop for 3 days. I have loved all the Lego games, and this comes to a close second next to Lego Star Wars. Great game, and a lot of fun. It is also surprisingly accurate to the actual story of Lord of the Rings. Recommended by me
customer_reviews.author: Kely

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining Lord of the Rings Lego Xbox game
customer_reviews.text: You really can't go wrong with these Lego video games. They are very entertaining. My 11 year old son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Timko

customer_reviews.title: Hours and Hours of Fun for My Entire Family
customer_reviews.text: This game has become the favorite Lego game in our family, as we all enjoy playing it. The quests are not overly complicated for our elder children (aged 9 and 11), but we have had to aid the younger ones while playing (aged 5 & 6). There is a lot less schtick in this Lego game versus others, but I was still hoping to unlock Hans Solo or Indiana Jones or some such other "goofy" character. This game has also provided us with MANY more hours of play than many of its predecessors.
customer_reviews.author: D. Noyes

customer_reviews.title: "FUN-FILLED And EXCITING!"
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter, who loves everything LEGO, and is collecting these games for her XBox 360. In comparison to her non-lego Lord Of the Rings, she finds this easier to play, less frustrating, and just as challenging. As I watched her play, I can see the enjoyment. Colorful, and provides hours of entertainment. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Author/Reviewer Geri AhearnTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Not Backward Compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in hopes of playing on my Xbox One. Sadly not backward compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: I've never played video games before, never grew up with them never saw them, you get the gist. I played this at bestbuy and decided to buy it and I have to say, it's really entertaining. I like that it's easy enough that I don't need to know much about video games to play it, the levels are straight forward and it's not stressful trying to complete them. And the little explanatory videos that move the game along are beyond hilarious. Especially if you are a fan of the movies.
customer_reviews.author: jt1124

customer_reviews.title: Kids still have fun with this!
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift that the kids continue to go back to time and again (when video game time is allowed). They admit it is "addictive," so the creators must have done their job right. That said, it makes the job as the parent a little more challenging, but at least they are never bored when playing LOTR Lego Style!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Miller

customer_reviews.title: Exploring Middle Earth
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old and myself (42) love playing this together. Some of the "missions" are a little dark, like the movie. My other children will definitely be 10 before they play or watch this one. The ring wraiths would be too scary for my 7 year old. For the most part, the story line follows the movies, without too much violence. The makers were very good about keeping the story line light for children. I love the Tolkien books and highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: pleased

customer_reviews.title: Bought as gift
customer_reviews.text: My nephew has perhaps one of the greatest collections of Legos in the world, but he is getting a bit older now. This was the perfect gift as he loves LOTR. He got a Lego/LOTR gift all in one! The voices are great on the game and I love the Lego fiures. Again they spent hours playing it so 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: James O.

customer_reviews.title: In line with the other LEGO games and completed by ...
customer_reviews.text: In line with the other LEGO games and completed by my 8 year old son in a marathon session over the weekend at the start of his school break.
customer_reviews.author: OnePaddle

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun
customer_reviews.text: The way this game is structured - especially compared to all of the other Lego movie adaptations is a bit confusing at first (think harry potter compared to Pirates or Star Wars). However, the story scenes are great, the playability is both challenging and still possible - a hallmark of the Lego series. Bottom line: it's a really fun game
customer_reviews.author: K. Click

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego addition
customer_reviews.text: This game was great! Played just like watching the movie about, but with cheeky lego additions that made this game very funny. It caught on all the funny things from the movie and made them better. This lego game goes back to the good old Indiana Jones feel of playing rather than the direction some of the newer games felt.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Game would not work, keeps freezing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this preowned game, and upon opening it and attempting to play it, it kept freezing up at the same spot every single time i try to play it. I am returning it. I should've known, since it was preowned.
customer_reviews.author: eva v.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Lego series. It is a fun adventure puzzle game that is great for fans of Lego and even greater for fans of LOTR. This game is easy enough that you can play with children and interesting enough that you can play as an adult. If you haven't tried the series yet LOTR is one of the newer incarnations and a great place to start!
customer_reviews.author: MelanieNichole

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the character selection. Both the quantity of playable characters and the method to select them.(A nice popup wheel for quick picks). I also greatly enjoyed the detail and accuracy to the movie. There was, as with all of the Lego games, a great deal of humor involved. (Boromir getting shot by a banana, then a chicken by the Uruk-Hai) For the completionists out there, there are a great deal of achievements. All with there own humor and move tie-ins. Overall a fun game for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: JDE

customer_reviews.title: Best Lego game yet!
customer_reviews.text: I've played just about every Lego game there is and this is by far my favorite. You get to roam Middle Earth in a fantastic sandbox format, solve quests, build with mithril, and play out the movies. Epic levels include fighting the Balrog as you fall through Moria as Gandalf and the introduction with Sauron. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Another fun LEGO game!
customer_reviews.text: A couple of years ago we started buying these LEGO games for the kids, and they have definitely been the most played and the biggest hits! Indiana Jones, Harry Potter, Star Wars, Batman, and now Lord of the Rings. You can easily make hours disappear with these addicting games. Lord of the Rings has dialogue that moves the story along and ties it to the movies, with a little humor thrown in. Fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Ross Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the Whole Family!
customer_reviews.text: Yet another wonderful game for Xbox from the LEGO line. Lots of fun, missions to accomplish, and teamwork is vital to success. A far better choice of game for children than the standard shoot-em-up variety. We have bought, played, and loved almost every one of the LEGO games for Xbox and this one is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S. Toy

customer_reviews.title: Nine-Year-Old Boys Love
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Lego game we bought for our kids in the xBox 360 version. They have many other Lego games for Wii (Star Wars, Batman, Indiana Jones, Harry Potter). It doesn't seem to matter to them that the story is not one they are very familiar with. They seem to enjoy it as much as the others.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: The game itself is another decent LEGO game...but it has glitches
customer_reviews.text: Don't know about other editions, but the XBOX 360 version had multiple glitches which caused the game to freeze during play. My wife and I don't have a lot of time to play games nowadays and are VERY frustrated when we have to replay a level we just nearly finished beating because of faulty bugs. Jeers Tell-Tale Games. ***We also found these problems with LEGO Batman 2.***
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Lego lord of the rings
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 yr old and 16 yr old grandsons for Xmas. They spend a lot of time in front of the X-Box 360, and desperatly wanted this as one of their presents. The price was much cheaper on Amazon.com then Walmart. I highly recommend it as they have really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Drill Queen

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: Really fun game. There is so much to do, and if you get bored of missions you can roam middle earth to complete even more tasks. There is also a bonus mission at the end of the game, that takes you to a map of middle earth in which you can break just about everything!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Fun game with the kids
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game to play with the kids, these lego games are perfect because you can't lose. I love seeing lord of the rings in Lego!
customer_reviews.author: William Martin

customer_reviews.title: LOTR Legos fun!
customer_reviews.text: OK so I am a LOTR nerd so I am almost obligated to like this game.... ... and guess what I do! This game uses the voices of the actors from the original films, so that it's like the ones in the movies, also has some "Legos" humor which is fun. I recommend it - fun game!
customer_reviews.author: MidniteFury7

customer_reviews.title: Silly fun
customer_reviews.text: Not the best Lego game, but fun. I enjoy being able to flip between different scenes in the story. Not a big fan of having to gather mithril bricks and finding blueprints to craft items. Really not a fan of the fact that you have to wander around and find the characters you can unlock.
customer_reviews.author: Liz A-O

customer_reviews.title: Best LEGO game so far
customer_reviews.text: As a fan of LOTR and LEGO games this was a real treat. Not all LEGO games are created equal. Some are downright abysmal (Indiana Jones I'm looking at you!) but LEGO LOTR catches the look and feel of the movies while mixing in varied gameplay elements to keep things fresh. Could have done without the voices though. They're okay for original stories like the LEGO Batman franchise but the fans already know what is said in the movie adaptations so the classic pantomime intepretation LEGO Star Wars began with would be much more appreciated. Still I couldn't get enough of this game and I can't wait for the inevitable sequel that covers the Hobbit trilogy!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to figure it out
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very video game savvy and this one is a little hard for me. I like clear cut actions etc. I know the storyline, of course, but I'm just not good at this. It's hard to figure out what exactly you're supposed to be doing to move the story forward. I don't think it's very intuitive and I just didn't have the patience to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: CNDENNIS

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: If you love the Lego games this one will be no different, when Lord of the Rings and Lego combine it is a great adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: BAD DISC
customer_reviews.text: Disc is unreadable and will not play...this is unacceptable as this was a gift and was only opened this past weekend conveniently after the return window is closed...
customer_reviews.author: sara domke

customer_reviews.title: All the charm we've come to expect!
customer_reviews.text: The other installments in the 'Lego' video game franchise are mostly quite good, and this is no exception. The humor is all there, it's a little darker than the others that I've played though, so it may not be for little ones who enjoyed Lego Batman or Lego Star Wars.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Philpott

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: The LEGO games appear to have lost their luster in my eyes. Whereas I eagerly used to eat up the comedy and the styling, I now find myself wishing they had advanced the games a bit further. In terms of the story in regards to Lord of the Rings, the developers did a fantastic job with recreating the movie experience. This is definitely a good game, but I wonder if I may be getting too old for them now.
customer_reviews.author: Kover

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but sometimes repetitive.
customer_reviews.text: This was an overall good game. I have always loved LOTR and Lego, so the combination was great. Pros: -Fun game. -Child friendly. -Easy to play. -Interesting new features. Cons: -Repetitive. In some missions you literally have to do the same thing over and over again with little variation. -The format was a little different from other lego games, being completely free roam. This made it confusing. Overall I love the game and it is a good game to play with friends.
customer_reviews.author: StephenJF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game
customer_reviews.text: Lord of the rings fan, Love the game. Very true to lego and the movies. As well in this one they speak. A bit different at first but still amazing. You can be super seperated in the levels by in game miles. I think this one tops the lego charts.
customer_reviews.author: Luky_shot

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kids
customer_reviews.text: This game is a nice way for younger kids to be exposed to The Lord Of The Rings Trilogy. The movies are a little violent and scary for kids. This game uses the Voices from the movies and makes things light and fun. It is a little hard because there is no guide book to help when you stuck but there are online helps. There are a lot of little things to do but over all an enjoyable game and experience with another player.
customer_reviews.author: michael andrews

customer_reviews.title: Lego Games are Great
customer_reviews.text: My grade-school age kids love this game. We just watched the three movies and now they get to play the game, which wouldn't be as fun without knowing the plot. Terrific graphics, rated G, and lots of good puzzles. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Beowulf

customer_reviews.title: Fun time killer
customer_reviews.text: This game is pretty good, a lot better in Co-op than single player, or else some of the tasks in the game can take way too long. If you and a buddy are looking for something that isnt to serious to burn some xbox time this is the best i have come across. The split screen is pretty clever and actually works, too
customer_reviews.author: zak montana

customer_reviews.title: ADORBS
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely am in LOVE with this game. The game play is very easy to maneuver through and the characters are so cute! I was happy that the game stuck to the plot of the trilogy. One of the the best games I've played in a very long time. Great for all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: If you like Lego video games, you'll definitely want this in your collection.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best of the Lego games. Tons of missions, a huge world to explore, and the usual Lego humor are all present.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: All the LEGO games I have played have been amazing (the Star Wars, Indiana Jones, and Harry Potter games, and Pirates of the Carribbean). People who have played the previous games might wonder if it's worth picking another one up. "Isn't it just the same game with different characters?" Nope. LEGO and TT constantly find ways to improve on the gameplay mechanics. Sure some of the gameplay is the same, but it's solid gameplay, so that's okay. And they add so much new stuff (finding mithril and taking it to a blacksmith to get special armor, weapons, or helpful items), that it is definitely a worthy addition to the LEGO video game series. This is the best one yet.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: This is prob the best lego game ( at least to me ) ever made to date ...But I'm a lotr fan so I'm kinda biased..Only thing that is kind of an issue is how the 2 player screen flips around, my kids get kind of confused ...
customer_reviews.author: Kelly L. Golen

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Does It Again!
customer_reviews.text: All the LEGO games have been fun, by with dialogue from the actual movies, they have their biggest hit yet. The only problem I've had with it was a small glitch that prevented me from completing every level, but that's what a new save slot is for...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bockelman

customer_reviews.title: Exploring Middle Earth
customer_reviews.text: What a great game!!! Reliving the movies with quests and scenes, this is great fun. Exploring middle earth, the addition of added quests to get special gifts, and crafting at the blacksmith in Bree is all great! This game is fun for the whole family!
customer_reviews.author: loriann12062

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: If you like the other Lego movie games, you will love this one! Lots of fun and it follows the movies very well. If you haven't seen the movies, you may have a little trouble working thru it. But you will love it! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Gift for the hubby
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband during Christmas. It was half price so I took a shot he might like it. He has played it a few times and seems to like the graphics. The game looks fun to play if you like mission type games.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Clevenger

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: My three kids love playing this game. I have a 14 year old son, 12 year old daughter, and 8 year old daughter. The graphics and story lines are great. It is easy enough for my 8 year old and challenging enough for my avid video game playing son. You can play two player which is fun for my kids. It is also fun to watch the kids get along and work together. I like the music and how it mimics the movie, but is appropriate for all my children. I would recommend this game.
customer_reviews.author: Soccer mom

customer_reviews.title: love lego games
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat twist and a little different to the Harry Potter ones. My husband likes it better but I am still a big HP fan. I would recommend. Amazon is beating GameStop's new in box price and with Prime, there is no shipping cost.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: When you need a break -
customer_reviews.text: When you need break from all the intense FPS and RPG games this is a great choice. It is also something I can play when the grand kids are around since I won't play the intense games when they are around. If you like LOTR you will like this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: I judge these by how well they hold my kids interest -- this one was good but not as good as Lego Indiana Jones which they seemed to love a lot more despite having more bias in favor of Lord of the Rings
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well written game. It has some bugs and glitches but other than that it works really well. It's fun to experience middle earth. Sound bites come from the movies so it really plays according to the movie mostly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Spigarelli

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun product, good entertainment for 3 and 5 year old and parents. Makes a rainy day go quickly.
customer_reviews.author: CarolofMaine

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Lord of the Rings
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game and funny to! I bought the Lego harry potter games as well and all three are amazing and fun! if you like legos and lord of the rings try this game out. I bet you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Lubeski

customer_reviews.title: Amazing game
customer_reviews.text: Best Lego game yet! I had doubts with the characters having actual dialog ruining the humor but they still work it in quite nicely! The split screen the main world is huge, as well as the fast travel system. And the side quest system made for a lot of extra fun.
customer_reviews.author: Stealthx01

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: I love playing the lego games with my son. We both enjoy this game, and it's cool because the lego characters actually talk in this one :) Lego Lord of the Rings is easy to figure out and fun to play!
customer_reviews.author: alexmyangel

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite Lego games!
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of the Lego Xbox Games- this is by far one of my favorites! If you like the lego games buy this right now! If you've never played lego games but are thinking about it buy this right now!
customer_reviews.author: CaitlinDevereaux

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I'm a teenager so this game got kind of childish and dumb at times, but it was still really enjoyable. Overall I thought the game was kind of short, but it does allow you to do more things after you finish the story, common with lego games.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Raab

customer_reviews.title: Among the best LEGO Games
customer_reviews.text: As both a LEGO and LOTR Fan, I thoroughly enjoyed this game. The cut-scene animations are fantastic. The gameplay is among the best of the LEGO games I've played. I have experienced some stability issues, and IMHO they could stand to have a different button for selecting items from your pack/circle thing, and the activating of things in the world. Sometimes it seems that the B button has too many uses and the game has a hard time figuring out what use of B to do. But minor annoyances aside, it's a great game.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Sandstrom

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun. Great for the whole family and will keep you busy for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Kids won't stop playing
customer_reviews.text: Kids aged 4-14 are crazy about this game. I cant seem to get them off of this game! From the catchy tunes to the fun levels......these guys would starve if i didnt force them to get off of it and eat meals!
customer_reviews.author: lwitty

customer_reviews.title: but really its not to bad, we just dont play video games too often
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game, some parts we have troubles with figuring out what to do, but really its not to bad, we just dont play video games too often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: LEGO Lord of the Rings - Xbox 360
product_meta.description:
Based on The Lord of the Rings motion picture trilogy, LEGO The Lord of the Rings follows the original storylines of The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, and The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, taking players through the epic story events reimagined with the humor and endless variety of LEGO play. Trusted with the dangerous task to destroy an ancient magical ring that threatens all that is good, Frodo is forced to leave his peaceful home. But the ring wants to be found and the road to Mount Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed, will be perilous and riddled with Orcs and fouler things. To help Frodo, a Fellowship is formed —Aragorn the Ranger, Gandalf the Wizard, Legolas the Elf, Gimli the Dwarf, Boromir a Man of Gondor, and Frodo’s Hobbit friends Sam, Merry and Pippin. Players relive the legend through the LEGO minifigures, as they explore wonders, solve timeless riddles, and overcome endless foes in their quest to destroy the Ring.

AMAZON.COM




LEGO The Lord of the Rings is based on The Lord of the Rings motion picture trilogy and follows the original storylines of The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers, and The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King. Now the entire family can team up in pairs as adorable LEGO The Lord the Rings minifigures to experience countless dangers, solve riddles and battle formidable foes on their journey to Mount Doom.





Explore all of the open-world 
of Middle-earth



Players will take on the 
form of their favorite members



Destroy The One Ring

SYNOPSIS
 LEGO The Lord of the Rings takes players along on the adventures of Frodo Baggins and his unlikely fellowship as they set out on a perilous journey to destroy The One Ring and save Middle-earth. Kids, tweens, teens and parents can traverse the Misty Mountains, explore the Mines of Moria, knock on the Black Gate of Mordor, and partake in epic battles with Orcs, Uruk-hai, the Balrog and other fearsome foes while harnessing the humor and imagination of LEGO gameplay to solve puzzles and explore Middle-earth. Players will take on the form of their favorite members of the fellowship – Frodo the Hobbit, Aragorn the Ranger, Gandalf the Wizard, Legolas the Elf, Gimli the Dwarf, Boromir a Man of Gondor, and Frodo's Hobbit friends Sam, Merry and Pippin – as they relive the most momentous events from the films.



KEY FEATURES:
 * Explore all of the open-world of Middle-earth and experience epic battles with Orcs, Uruk-hai, the Balrog, the Witch-king, and other fearsome creatures.
 * Wield the power of the Palantír or Seeing-stone (‘one that looks far-away’), and jump between multiple storylines.
 * Experience the LEGO The Lord of the Rings heroes come to life in an all new way, as they deliver the dialogue from the films.
 * Collect, combine and forge new items in the Blacksmith Shop using Mithril, the most precious metal in Middle-earth.
 * Discover and unlock over more than 60 playable characters, including Frodo, Aragorn, Gandalf, and many others.
 * Collect and use a variety of weaponry and magical items, including the Light of Earendil, Elven rope, swords, and bows.
 * Play with family and friends with easy access drop-in, drop-out gameplay option.
feature_bullets: Explore all of the open-world of Middle-earth and experience epic battles with Orcs, Uruk-hai, the Balrog, the Witch-king, and other fearsome creatures.
Wield the power of the Palantír or Seeing-stone (‘one that looks far-away’), and jump between multiple storylines.
Experience the LEGO The Lord of the Rings heroes come to life in an all new way with the minifig characters delivering the dialogue from the films.
Discover and unlock over more than 60 playable characters, including Frodo, Aragorn, Gandalf, and many others.
Collect and use a variety of weaponry and magical items, including the Light of Earendil, Elven rope, swords, and bows.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars685 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
